pages.text: The methods of cursing an Item are still unknown. Some say the item has to be exposed directly to a specific source of fear, or that it has to go through a ritual to receive a curse. But, what is known is that you can easily transfer curses between items.

To transfer a Blood curse from an item to another, you can use a Blood curse table. To do it, you'll need ingredients relating to it's element.$(br)A Blood curse table uses any Raw Meat or villager's Organs.

To transfer an Energy curse from an item to another, you can use an Energy curse table. To do it, you'll need ingredients relating to it's element.$(br)An Energy curse table uses Lapis Lazuli, Amethyst Shards, Prismarine Shards, Quartz or Emeralds.

To transfer a Knowledge curse from an item to another, you can use a Knowledge curse table. To do it, you'll need ingredients relating to it's element.$(br)A Knowledge curse table uses Glass, Gold Ingots, Glowstone Dust, Paper or Candles.

To transfer a Death curse from an item to another, you can use a Death curse table. To do it, you'll need ingredients relating to it's element.$(br)A Death curse table uses Bones, Sand, Gravel or villager's Ashes.
Put the cursed item on top of the ingredient. In the middle, the item which the curse will be transfered into.
